member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.PhoneLineConfiguration.SRTPMode
member.summary: Gets the default security mode for incoming and outgoing calls.

member.summary: Gets the desired time after the SIP account registration expires (in seconds).
member.remarks: The SIP account is registered to the PBX for a limited amount of time. When this time expires the PBX can no longer contact the registered SIP account.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall
member.summary: Represents a phone call. Defines properties and methods for monitoring and controlling calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Start
member.summary: Starts the outgoing call.
member.remarks: It has no effect on incoming calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Answer
member.summary: Answers the incoming call.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Answer(Ozeki.VoIP.CallType)
member.summary: Answers the incoming call with the specified media types.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.RingWithEarlyMedia
member.summary: Sends a provisional response with media description to the caller. When early media response is sent, the softphone can send media data to the other party while the phone is still ringing.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.RingWithEarlyMedia(Ozeki.VoIP.CallType)
member.summary: Sends a provisional response with media description to the caller. When early media response is sent, the softphone can send media data to the other party while the phone is still ringing.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Respond(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes)
member.summary: Sends a response to the caller with the specified status code.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Respond(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a response to the caller with the specified status code.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Reject
member.summary: Rejects the incoming call.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Reject(System.String)
member.summary: Rejects the incoming call.
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Forward(System.String)
member.summary: Forwards the incoming call to another phone.
member.param: The target number or full address. (eg. '855' or '855@atlanta.com')
member.remarks: It has no effect on outgoing calls.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.HangUp
member.summary: Hangs up the call. If the outgoing call has not been answered yet, it will be cancelled. If the incoming call has not been answered, it will be rejected.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.ToggleHold
member.summary: Puts the call on hold or takes the call off hold. (toggle) If the call is in InCall state, puts it on hold. If the call is in LocalHeld or InactiveHeld state, takes it off hold.
member.returns: True, if the call can be taken off hold; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Hold
member.summary: Puts the call on hold. If the call is already on local hold, it has no effect.
member.returns: True, if the call can be placed on hold; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.Unhold
member.summary: Takes the call off from hold. If the call is in progress, it has no effect.
member.returns: True, if the call can be taken off hold; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.BlindTransfer(System.String)
member.summary: Transfers the call to another phone number. A blind transfer is defined as a transfer made without notifying the destination party before transferring the call.
member.param: The call will be forwarded to this phone number

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.AttendedTransfer(Ozeki.VoIP.ICall)
member.summary: Transfers the call to another phone number. An attended transfer is a transfer made after notifying the destination party of the transfer.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.StartDTMFSignal(Ozeki.VoIP.DtmfNamedEvents)
member.summary: Starts sending the given DTMF signal continously until the StopDTMFSignal method called. The signalling mode will be detected automatically.
member.returns: False, if the remote part does not support receiving DTMF signals, or the call is not in state when DTMF signal can be sent; otherwise true.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.StartDTMFSignal(Ozeki.VoIP.DtmfNamedEvents,Ozeki.VoIP.DtmfSignalingMode)
member.summary: Starts sending the given DTMF signal continously until the StopDTMFSignal method called. If the remote party does not support the specified method, no DTMF signal will be sent.
member.param: Specifies the method used for signalling (eg. SIP INFO or RTP event)
member.returns: False, if the remote part does not support the specified signalling mode, or the call is not in state when DTMF signal can be sent; otherwise true.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.ICall.StopDTMFSignal(Ozeki.VoIP.DtmfNamedEvents)
member.summary: Stops the DTMF signalling.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.CallState
member.summary: States of an arbitrary call object.
member.remarks: This is a partially ordered set. During the call process a call object can hold states of the CallState enum. When a call is created by the softphone it has the Setup state, if some negative answer comes from the callee, the states changes into SetupError. When everything goes fine, the state changes into Ringing. From Ringing it can enter InCall, Rejected or Cancelled states. If someone picks up the phone the call enters InCall state. InCall state just can changes into Completed state. From Ringing it also can change into Rejected or Cancelled state. The state is Rejected when the callee reject the call. The state is Cancelled if the caller changes his mind and hangs up the phone.

member.summary: Ringing.

member.summary: Ringing with early media.

member.summary: Local call is forwarding.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.TimeMapper
member.summary: A belső, másodperces időskála és az egyéb különböző időskálák közötti megfeleltetést biztosítja valósidejű streameknél. Kívülről beérkezett adat (ExternalTime) első időpontja az aktuális rendszeridőhöz lesz rendelve, a további időpontok ebből számolódnak. Ez azért kell, hogy az A-V szinkronizálás biztosítva legyen akkor is, ha valósidőben érkezik az adat, és pl. a video később lesz elindítva.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError
member.summary: Defines errors for calls.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.NoError
member.summary: No error occurred.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.NoResponse
member.summary: No response received to a request (e.g. BYE) from the other party.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.SRTPError
member.summary: Incorrect media protocol in SDP.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.ConnectionError
member.summary: Connection lost with the remote address.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.ParseError
member.summary: The user-agent could not parse the message.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.RequestFailure
member.summary: Generic failure for a SIP request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.UnknownError
member.summary: Unexpected error occurred.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.BadRequest
member.summary: 400 - The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.Forbidden
member.summary: 403 - The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.NotFound
member.summary: 404 - The server has definitive information that the user does not exist at the domain specified in the Request-URI.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.RequestTimedOut
member.summary: 408 - The server could not produce a response within a suitable amount of time.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.Gone
member.summary: 410 - The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: 415 - The server is refusing to service the request because the message body of the request is in a format not supported by the server for the requested method.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.TemporarilyUnavailable
member.summary: 480 - The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is currently unavailable.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.CallDoesNotExist
member.summary: 481 - This status indicates that the UAS received a request that does not match any existing dialog.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.AddressIncomplete
member.summary: 484 - The server received a request with a Request-URI that was incomplete.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.BusyHere
member.summary: 486 - The callee's end system was contacted successfully, but the callee is currently not willing or able to take additional calls at this end system.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.NotAcceptableHere
member.summary: 488 - The session description such as the bandwidth, addressing type or codecs were not acceptable.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.RequestPending
member.summary: 491 - There is a pending request within the same call.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.ServerInternalError
member.summary: 500 - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.NotImplemented
member.summary: 501 - The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.BadGateway
member.summary: 502 - The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from the downstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: 503 - The server is temporarily unable to process the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.ServerTimeout
member.summary: 504 - The server did not receive a timely response from an external server it accessed in attempting to process the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.MessageTooLarge
member.summary: 513 - The server was unable to process the request since the message length exceeded its capabilities.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.BusyEverywhere
member.summary: 600 - The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is busy and does not wish to take the call at this time. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.GlobalFailureDecline
member.summary: 603 - The callee's machine was successfully contacted but the user explicitly does not wish to or cannot participate. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.DoesNotExistAnywhere
member.summary: 604 - The server has authoritative information that the user does not exist anywhere. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.GlobalFailureNotAcceptable
member.summary: 606 - The session description such as the bandwidth, addressing type or codecs were not acceptable. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.CallError.GlobalFailure
member.summary: 699 - The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIPAccount
member.summary: Represents a SIP user account.
member.remarks: This class stores the necessary user data for the registration to a SIP Registrar Proxy server. These data are: user name, registration name, registration password (see RFC 5322), SIP server IP address and port. This class also handles the case when you want to communicate with directly with a sIP tool. In this case the RequestrationRequired property needs to be set to false. In this case the class specifies a communication channel.

member.summary: The subscription has been accepted and authorized.

member.summary: The event-type is not supported.

member.summary: The subscription has not been refreshed and it has been expired.

member.summary: The subscription is no longer active.

member.summary: The subscription has been received, but that policy information is insufficient to accept or deny the subscription at this time.

member.summary: Provides data for subscription state changed event.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.SubscriptionStateChangeEventArgs.#ctor(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.SubscriptionState,System.Nullable{Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: If the new state is terminated, the reason of the termination.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.SubscriptionStateChangeEventArgs.EventState
member.summary: Gets the new state.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.SubscriptionStateChangeEventArgs.TerminationReason
member.summary: Gets the reason of the termination when the state is Terminated.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason.Deactivated
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the subscriber SHOULD retry immediately with a new subscription. One primary use of such a status code is to allow migration of subscriptions between nodes. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "deactivated".

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason.Probation
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the client SHOULD retry at some later time. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re- subscribe

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason.Rejected
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated due to change in authorization policy. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "rejected".

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason.Timeout
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because it was not refreshed before it expired. Clients MAY re-subscribe immediately. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "timeout".

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason.GiveUp
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the notifier could not obtain authorization in a timely fashion. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe; otherwise, the client MAY retry immediately, but will likely get put back into pending state.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.TerminationReason.NoResource
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the resource state which was being monitored no longer exists. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "noresource".

member.remarks: 2xx kikuldesnel a server INVITE tranzakcio Accepted allapotba lep. Elvileg nem az Accepted allapot dolga, hogy ujra kikuldje a 2xx uzenetet, igy ezert kellett bevezetni ezt az osztalyt. Az Accepted allapothoz azert nem lehet beletenni, mert az ACK mar nem a tranzakcio resze.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.Transaction.ClientTransaction.DoesMatchResponse(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Message.Response.Response)
member.summary: Determine whatever the given response is matched to the client transaction.
member.remarks:
1. If the response has the same value of the branch parameter in the top Via header field as the branch parameter in the top Via header field of the request that created the transaction.
2. If the method parameter in the CSeq header field matches the method of the request that created the transaction. The method is needed since a CANCEL request constitutes a different transaction, but shares the same value of the branch parameter.
member.returns: True if the message is good for the client transaction.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ISIPMessageManipulator
member.summary: Input/Output SIP Message Manipulator.
member.remarks: During the SIP communication the SIP stack sends and receives messages that can be manipulated through this Manipulator interface. As the system is totally closed, therefore the messages can only be modified by string manipulation right before sending or after receiving them. It is possible to inster new extension headers into the messages according to the content.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes
member.summary: Specifies SIP response codes.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Trying
member.summary: (100) This response indicates that the request has been received by the next-hop server and that some unspecified action is being taken on behalf of this call.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Ringing
member.summary: (180) This response may be used to initiate local ringback.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.CallIsBeingForwarded
member.summary: (181) A server may use this status code to indicate that the call is being forwarded to a different set of destinations.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Queued
member.summary: (182) The called party is temporarily unavailable, but the server has ecided to queue the call rather than reject it.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.SessionProgress
member.summary: (183) The 183 (Session Progress) response is used to convey information about the progress of the call that is not otherwise classified.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.OK
member.summary: (200) The request has succeeded.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.MultipleChoices
member.summary: (300) The address in the request resolved to several choices, each with its own specific location, and the user (or UA) can select a preferred communication end point and redirect its request to that location.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.MovedPermanently
member.summary: (301) The user can no longer be found at the address in the Request-URI, and the requesting client should retry at the new address given by the Contact header field.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.MovedTemporarily
member.summary: (302) The requesting client should retry the request at the new address(es) given by the Contact header field.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.UseProxy
member.summary: (305) The requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Contact field.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.AlternativeService
member.summary: (380) The call was not successful, but alternative services are possible.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.BadRequest
member.summary: (400) The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Unauthorized
member.summary: (401) The request requires user authentication.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.PaymentRequired
member.summary: (402) Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Forbidden
member.summary: (403) The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.NotFound
member.summary: (404) The server has definitive information that the user does not exist at the domain specified in the Request-URI.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: (405) The method specified in the Request-Line is understood, but not allowed for the address identified by the Request-URI.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.NotAcceptable
member.summary: (406) The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities that have content characteristics not acceptable according to the Accept header field sent in the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: (407) This code is similar to 401 (Unauthorized), but indicates that the client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.RequestTimedOut
member.summary: (408) The server could not produce a response within a suitable amount of time.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Gone
member.summary: (410) The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: (413) The server is refusing to process a request because the request entity-body is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.RequestURITooLong
member.summary: (414) The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: (415) The server is refusing to service the request because the message body of the request is in a format not supported by the server for the requested method.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.UnsupportedURIScheme
member.summary: (416) The server cannot process the request because the scheme of the URI in the Request-URI is unknown to the server.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.BadExtension
member.summary: (420) The server did not understand the protocol extension specified in a Proxy-Require or Require header field.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.ExtensionRequired
member.summary: (421) The UAS needs a particular extension to process the request, but this extension is not listed in a Supported header field in the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.IntervalTooBrief
member.summary: (423) The server is rejecting the request because the expiration time of the resource refreshed by the request is too short.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.TemporarilyUnavailable
member.summary: (480) The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is currently unavailable.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.CallDoesNotExist
member.summary: (481) This status indicates that the UAS received a request that does not match any existing dialog.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.LoopDetected
member.summary: (482) The server has detected a loop.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.TooManyHops
member.summary: (483) The server received a request that contains a Max-Forwards header field with the value zero.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.AddressIncomplete
member.summary: (484) The server received a request with a Request-URI that was incomplete.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Ambiguous
member.summary: (485) The Request-URI was ambiguous.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.BusyHere
member.summary: (486) The callee's end system was contacted successfully, but the callee is currently not willing or able to take additional calls at this end system.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.RequestTerminated
member.summary: (487) The request was terminated by a BYE or CANCEL request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.NotAcceptableHere
member.summary: (488) The session description such as the bandwidth, addressing type or codecs were not acceptable.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.RequestPending
member.summary: (491) There is a pending request within the same call.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.Undecipherable
member.summary: (493) The request was received by a UAS that contained an encrypted MIME body for which the recipient does not possess or will not provide an appropriate decryption key.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.ServerInternalError
member.summary: (500) The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.NotImplemented
member.summary: (501) The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.BadGateway
member.summary: (502) The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from the downstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: (503) The server is temporarily unable to process the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.ServerTimeout
member.summary: (504) The server did not receive a timely response from an external server it accessed in attempting to process the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.VersionNotSupported
member.summary: (505) The server does not support, or refuses to support, the SIP protocol version that was used in the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.MessageTooLarge
member.summary: (513) The server was unable to process the request since the message length exceeded its capabilities.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.BusyEverywhere
member.summary: (600) The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is busy and does not wish to take the call at this time. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.GlobalFailureDecline
member.summary: (603) The callee's machine was successfully contacted but the user explicitly does not wish to or cannot participate. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.DoesNotExistAnywhere
member.summary: (604) The server has authoritative information that the user does not exist anywhere. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: F:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.ResponseCodes.GlobalFailureNotAcceptable
member.summary: (606) The session description such as the bandwidth, addressing type or codecs were not acceptable. The server has definitive information about a particular user, not just the particular instance.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.UserAgents.RequestContentBuffer
member.summary: Message Contents
member.remarks: A komminukáció során szükség van arra, hogy a kiküldött üzenetek tartalmait nyilván tudjuk tartani. Ugyanis ezt eddig a tranzakciót indító üzenetekben tartottuk nyilván. Ezzel az a baj, hogy ezt a tartalmat csak a tranzakción keresztül lehetett elérni, ami referencuiális hivatkozást generált. Így például az authentikációnál elő kell keresni a tranzakciót lekérni az ő üzenetét majd kimásolni a tartalmát. Egy ez az információ nem egy jól elkülönített helyen jelenik meg, hanem a kódban fragmentálva. Mivel minket azonban pl csak az authentikálásnál az üzenet eredeti tartalma érdekelt, ezt ebben a bufferben tárolni tudjuk, így a magasabb rendű komponensek nem függnek az alacsonyabaktól.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.Dialog.SIPDialog.AddUASContactHeader(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Message.Response.Response,System.String)
member.summary: 12.1.1 Creation of a Dialog / UAS behavior The URI provided in the Contact header field MUST be a SIP or SIPS URI. If the request that initiated the dialog contained a SIPS URI in the Request-URI or in the top Record-Route header field value, if there was any, or the Contact header field if there was no Record-Route header field, the Contact header field in the response MUST be a SIPS URI.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.Dialog.SIPDialog.AddUACContactHeader(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Message.Request.Request,System.String)
member.summary: 12.1.2 Creation of a Dialog / UAC Behavior When a UAC sends a request that can establish a dialog (such as an INVITE) it MUST provide a SIP or SIPS URI with global scope in the Contact header field of the request. If the request has a Request-URI or a topmost Route header field value with a SIPS URI, the Contact header field MUST contain a SIPS URI.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.Dialog.SIPDialog.CopyRecordRouteHeaders(Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Message.Request.Request,Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Message.Response.Response)
member.summary: 12.1.1 Creation of a Dialog / UAS behavior When a UAS responds to a request with a response that establishes a dialog (such as a 2xx to INVITE), the UAS MUST copy all Record-Route header field values from the request into the response (including the URIs, URI parameters, and any Record-Route header field parameters, whether they are known or unknown to the UAS) and MUST maintain the order of those values.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.Transport.SIPTransportLayer
member.summary:
RFC 3261 - 18 Transport
The transport layer is responsible for the actual transmission of requests and responses over network transports. This includes determination of the connection to use for a request or response in the case of connection-oriented transports.

member.summary:
8.1.1 Generating the Request
A REGISTER-hez a metodust kell hasznalni. A CANCEL-hez a metodust kell hasznalni.

8.1.1 Generating the Request
A valid SIP request formulated by a UAC MUST, at a minimum, contain the following header fields: To, From, CSeq, Call-ID, Max-Forwards, and Via; all of these header fields are mandatory in all SIP requests.
A REGISTER-hez a PrepareNewRegister metodust kell hasznalni.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Authentication.DigestElement
member.grammar:
dig-resp = username / realm / nonce / digest-uri / dresponse / algorithm / cnonce / opaque / message-qop / nonce-count / auth-param algorithm = "algorithm" equal ( "MD5" / "MD5-sess" / token ) username = "username" equal username-value username-value = quoted-string
digest-uri = "uri" equal ldquot digest-uri-value rdquot digest-uri-value = rquest-uri rquest-uri = "*" / absoluteuri
message-qop = "qop" equal qop-value qop-value = "auth" / "auth-int" / token
cnonce = "cnonce" equal cnonce-value cnonce-value = nonce-value nonce-value = quoted-string
nonce-count = "nc" equal nc-value nc-value = 8lhex
dresponse = "response" equal request-digest request-digest = ldquot 32lhex rdquot
auth-param = auth-param-name equal ( token / quoted-string ) auth-param-name = token
auth-scheme = token realm = "realm" EQUAL realm-value realm-value = quoted-string

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SIP.Layers.IDFactories.SIPIDFactory
member.summary: It generates random identifiers and tags for transactions and dialogs.
member.remarks:
19.3 Tags
The "tag" parameter is used in the To and From header fields of SIP messages. It serves as a general mechanism to identify a dialog, which is the combination of the Call-ID along with two tags, one from each participant in the dialog. When a UA sends a request outside of a dialog, it contains a From tag only, providing "half" of the dialog ID. The dialog is completed from the response(s), each of which contributes the second half in the To header field. The forking of SIP requests means that multiple dialogs can be established from a single request. This also explains the need for the two-sided dialog identifier; without a contribution from the recipients, the originator could not disambiguate the multiple dialogs established from a single request.
When a tag is generated by a UA for insertion into a request or response, it MUST be globally unique and cryptographically random with at least 32 bits of randomness. A property of this selection requirement is that a UA will place a different tag into the From header of an INVITE than it would place into the To header of the response to the same INVITE. This is needed in order for a UA to invite itself to a session, a common case for "hairpinning" of calls in PSTN gateways. Similarly, two INVITEs for different calls will have different From tags, and two responses for different calls will have different To tags.
Besides the requirement for global uniqueness, the algorithm for generating a tag is implementation-specific. Tags are helpful in fault tolerant systems, where a dialog is to be recovered on an alternate server after a failure. A UAS can select the tag in such a way that a backup can recognize a request as part of a dialog on the failed server, and therefore determine that it should attempt to recover the dialog and any other state associated with it.

member.summary:
This gives a suggestion for the quality of the encoding as an integer value.
a=quality:quality

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.SDP.Message.SDPFields.Attributes.QualityAttribute.Quality
member.summary: 10 - the best still-image quality the compression scheme can give. 5 - the default behaviour given no quality suggestion. 0 - the worst still-image quality the codec designer thinks is still usable.

member.name: T:Ozeki.VoIP.SDP.Message.SDPFields.Attributes.RtpmapAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute maps from an RTP payload type number (as used in an "m=" line) to an encoding name denoting the payload format to be used. It also provides information on the clock rate and encoding parameters.
a=rtpmap:payload_type encoding_name/clock_rate [/encoding_parameters]
member.example: m=audio 49230 RTP/AVP 96 97 98 a=rtpmap:96 L8/8000 a=rtpmap:97 L16/8000 a=rtpmap:98 L16/11025/2

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263Plus.H263PlusPacket.RR
member.summary: Reserved bits. It SHALL be zero and MUST be ignored by receivers.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263Plus.H263PlusPacket.P
member.summary: Picture start

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263Plus.H263PlusPacket.V
member.summary: Indicates the presence of an 8-bit field containing information for Video Redundancy Coding (VRC), which follows immediately after the initial 16 bits of the payload header, if present. For syntax and semantics of that 8-bit VRC field

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263Plus.H263PlusPacket.PLEN
member.summary: Length, in bytes, of the extra picture header. If no extra picture header is attached, PLEN is 0. If PLEN>0, the extra picture header is attached immediately following the rest of the payload header. Note that the length reflects the omission of the first two bytes of the picture start code (PSC).

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263Plus.H263PlusPacket.PEBIT
member.summary: Indicates the number of bits that shall be ignored in the last byte of the picture header. If PLEN is not zero, the ignored bits shall be the least significant bits of the byte. If PLEN is zero, then PEBIT shall also be zero.

member.summary: Creates a object from a object.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263Plus.VRCHeader.TID
member.summary: Thread ID

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.F
P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.P
member.summary: P: 1 bit Optional PB-frames mode as defined by the H.263 [4]. "0" implies normal I or P frame, "1" PB-frames. When F=1, P also indicates modes: mode B if P=0, mode C if P=1.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.EBit
member.summary: EBIT: 3 bits End bit position specifies number of least significant bits that shall be ignored in the last data byte.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.SRC
member.summary: SRC : 3 bits Source format, bit 6,7 and 8 in PTYPE defined by H.263 [4], specifies the resolution of the current picture. 001 SUB-CIF 128x96 010 QCIF 176x144 011 CIF 352x288 100 4CIF 704x576 101 16CIF 1408x1152

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.I
member.summary: I: 1 bit. Picture coding type, bit 9 in PTYPE defined by H.263[4], "0" is intra-coded, "1" is inter-coded.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.U
member.summary: U: 1 bit Set to 1 if the Unrestricted Motion Vector option, bit 10 in PTYPE defined by H.263 [4] was set to 1 in the current picture header, otherwise 0.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.S
member.summary: S: 1 bit Set to 1 if the Syntax-based Arithmetic Coding option, bit 11 in PTYPE defined by the H.263 [4] was set to 1 for current picture header, otherwise 0.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.A
member.summary: A: 1 bit Set to 1 if the Advanced Prediction option, bit 12 in PTYPE defined by H.263 [4] was set to 1 for current picutre header, otherwise 0.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.R
member.summary: R: 4 bits Reserved, must be set to zero.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.DBQ
member.summary: DBQ: 2 bits Differential quantization parameter used to calculate quantizer for the B frame based on quantizer for the P frame, when PB-frames option is used. The value should be the same as DBQUANT defined by H.263 [4]. Set to zero if PB-frames option is not used.

member.name: P:Ozeki.VoIP.RTP.PacketProviders.H263.H263Packet.TRB
member.summary: TRB: 3 bits Temporal Reference for the B frame as defined by H.263 [4]. Set to zero if PB-frames option is not used.

member.name: M:Ozeki.VoIP.SRTP.SRTPCryptoContext.DeriveSrtpKeys(System.Int64)
member.summary: Derives the srtp session keys from the master key

members.member:
Transform a SRTP packet into a RTP packet. This method is called when a SRTP packet is received.
Operations done by the this operation include: Authentication check, Packet replay check and decryption.
Both encryption and authentication functionality can be turned off as long as the SRTPPolicy used in this SRTPCryptoContext is requires no encryption and no authentication. Then the packet will be sent out untouched. However this is not encouraged. If no SRTP feature is enabled, then we shall not use SRTP TransformConnector. We should use the original method (RTPManager managed transportation) instead.
@param pkt the RTP packet that is just received @return true if the packet can be accepted false if the packet failed authentication or failed replay check
Perform Counter Mode AES encryption / decryption @param pkt the RTP packet to be encrypted / decrypted

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Session.MediaChannelPair
member.summary: Hívás során előforduló média csatorna pár.
member.remarks:
A hívás során a média csatornákat párosítva kezeljük. Ami jött a felajánlásban, ugyanazokat a csatornákat kell visszaküldeni. Tehát egy távoli csatornához egy lokális csatornát párosítunk.
Eltároljuk az előző communication mode-ot a távoli és lokális csatornához is, mivel ha meg akarjuk nézni, mi változott az előző állapothoz képest, akkor azt is figyelembe kell venni.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidatePairState.Waiting
member.summary: A check has not been performed for this pair, and can be performed as soon as it is the highest-priority Waiting pair on the check list.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidatePairState.In_Progress
member.summary: A check has been sent for this pair, but the transaction is in progress.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidatePairState.Succeeded
member.summary: A check for this pair was already done and produced a successful result.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidatePairState.Failed
member.summary: A check for this pair was already done and failed, either never producing any response or producing an unrecoverable failure response.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidatePairState.Frozen
member.summary: A check for this pair hasn't been performed, and it can't yet be performed until some other check succeeds, allowing this pair to unfreeze and move into the Waiting state.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidateType.Host
member.summary: A candidate obtained by binding to a specific port from an IP address on the host. This includes IP addresses on physical interfaces and logical ones, such as ones obtained through Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) and Realm Specific IP (RSIP)

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidateType.ServerReflexive
member.summary: A candidate whose IP address and port are a binding allocated by a NAT for an agent when it sent a packet through the NAT to a server.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidateType.PeerReflexive
member.summary: A candidate whose IP address and port are a binding allocated by a NAT for an agent when it sent a STUN Binding request through the NAT to its peer.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.CandidateType.Relay
member.summary: A candidate obtained by sending a TURN Allocate request from a host candidate to a TURN server.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatDiscovery.Tests.Test1
member.summary:
TEST I Sends a STUN Binding Request to a server, without any flags set in the CHANGE-REQUEST attribute, and without the RESPONSE-ADDRESS attribute
IF (!received) : UDP blocked IF (Received IP == Current IP) : No NAT ELSE : NAT detected

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatDiscovery.Tests.Test1Again
member.summary:
Test I - 2 Sends a STUN Binding Request to a server, without any flags set in the CHANGE-REQUEST attribute, and without the RESPONSE-ADDRESS attribute Performs test I again, but this time, does so to the address and port from the CHANGED-ADDRESS attribute from the response to test I
IF (Received IP != IP from Previous Test I) : "Symmetric" NAT ELSE : Test III
IF (!Received) : Response error.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatDiscovery.Tests.Test3
member.summary:
Test III Sends a Binding Request with only the "change port" flag set in the CHANGE-REQUEST attribute set
IF received : "Restricted cone" NAT ELSE : "Port Restricted Cone" NAT

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatDiscovery.Tests.Test2Nat
member.summary:
Test II Sends a Binding Request with both the "change IP" and "change port" flags from the CHANGE-REQUEST attribute set
IF received : "Full-cone" NAT ELSE : Do Test I again with Server #2

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatDiscovery.Tests.Test2NoNat
member.summary:
TEST II Sends a Binding Request with both the "change IP" and "change port" flags from the CHANGE-REQUEST attribute set
IF received : Open Internet ELSE : "Symmetric" Firewall

member.param: Type of the NAT (e.g. Full-cone NAT)

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the NAT (e.g. Full-Cone NAT).

member.name: P:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatInfo.PublicAddress
member.summary: Gets the public address.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType
member.summary: Specifies the types of NAT.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.Unknown
member.summary: The system could not detect the type of the NAT.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.UdpBlocked
member.summary: Firewall that blocks UDP.
member.remarks: Probably no internet connection available or firewall issue.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.SymmetricFirewall
member.summary: Firewall that allows UDP out.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.OpenInternet
member.summary: The computer connects to the internet directly.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.FullCone
member.summary: Full-cone NAT, also known as one-to-one NAT
member.remarks: Once an internal address (iAddr:iPort) is mapped to an external address (eAddr:ePort), any packets from iAddr:iPort will be sent through eAddr:ePort. Any external host can send packets to iAddr:iPort by sending packets to eAddr:ePort.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.SymmetricNAT
member.summary: Symmetric NAT
member.remarks:
Each request from the same internal IP address and port to a specific destination IP address and port is mapped to a unique external source IP address and port, if the same internal host sends a packet even with the same source address and port but to a different destination, a different mapping is used. Only an external host that receives a packet from an internal host can send a packet back.
VoIP will not work using STUN method.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.RestrictedCone
member.summary: (Address) restricted cone NAT
member.remarks: Once an internal address (iAddr:iPort) is mapped to an external address (eAddr:ePort), any packets from iAddr:iPort will be sent through eAddr:ePort. An external host (hAddr:any) can send packets to iAddr:iPort by sending packets to eAddr:ePort only if iAddr:iPort has previously sent a packet to hAddr:any. "Any" means the port number doesn't matter.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.NatType.PortRestrictedCone
member.summary: Port-restricted cone NAT
member.remarks:
Like an address restricted cone NAT, but the restriction includes port numbers.
Once an internal address (iAddr:iPort) is mapped to an external address (eAddr:ePort), any packets from iAddr:iPort will be sent through eAddr:ePort. An external host (hAddr:hPort) can send packets to iAddr:iPort by sending packets to eAddr:ePort only if iAddr:iPort has previously sent a packet to hAddr:hPort.

member.summary: Specifies the type of a STUN attribute

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.MessageType
member.summary: The message type defines the message class (request, success response, failure response, or indication) and the message method (the primary function) of the STUN message.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode
member.summary: Specifies STUN attribute error codes

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.BadRequest
member.summary: A request was received by the server that requires an allocation to be in place, but no allocation exists, or a request was received that requires no allocation, but an allocation exists.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: The Binding Request did not contain a MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.UnknownAttribute
member.summary: The server did not understand a mandatory attribute in the request.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.StaleCredentials
member.summary: The Binding Request did contain a MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute, but it used a shared secret that has expired. The client should obtain a new shared secret and try again.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.IntegrityCheckFailure
member.summary: The Binding Request contained a MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute, but the HMAC failed verification. This could be a sign of a potential attack, or client implementation error.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.MissingUsername
member.summary: The Binding Request contained a MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute, but not a USERNAME attribute. Both must be present for integrity checks.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.UseTLS
member.summary: The Shared Secret request has to be sent over TLS, but was not received over TLS.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.ServerError
member.summary: The server has suffered a temporary error. The client should try again.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.GlobalFailure
member.summary: The server is refusing to fulfill the request. The client should not retry.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.TryAlternate
member.summary: The client should contact an alternate server for this request. This error response MUST only be sent if the request included a USERNAME attribute and a valid MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute; otherwise, it MUST NOT be sent and error code 400 (Bad Request) is suggested. This error response MUST be protected with the MESSAGE-INTEGRITY attribute, and receivers MUST validate the MESSAGE-INTEGRITY of this response before redirecting themselves to an alternate server.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.StaleNonce
member.summary: The NONCE used by the client was no longer valid. The client should retry, using the NONCE provided in the response.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.Forbidden
member.summary: The request was valid but cannot be performed due to administrative or similar restrictions.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.AllocationMismatch
member.summary: A request was received by the server that requires an allocation to be in place, but no allocation exists, or a request was received that requires no allocation, but an allocation exists.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.WrongCredentials
member.summary: The credentials in the (non-Allocate) request do not match those used to create the allocation.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.UnsupportedTransportProtocol
member.summary: The Allocate request asked the server to use a transport protocol between the server and the peer that the server does not support. NOTE: This does NOT refer to the transport protocol used in the 5-tuple.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.AllocationQuotaReached
member.summary: No more allocations using this username can be created at the present time.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.InsufficientCapacity
member.summary: The server is unable to carry out the request due to some capacity limit being reached. In an Allocate response, this could be due to the server having no more relayed transport addresses available at that time, having none with the requested properties, or the one that corresponds to the specified reservation token is not available.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.ConnectionAlreadyExists
member.summary: The connection to the server has been already established.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.ConnectionTimeoutOrFailure
member.summary: Couldn't connect to the server

member.name: F:Ozeki.Network.Nat.STUN.Message.ErrorCode.RoleConflict
member.summary: If the agent's tie-breaker is larger than or equal to the contents of the ICE-CONTROLLING attribute, the agent generates a Binding error response and includes an ERROR-CODE attribute with a value of 487 (Role Conflict) but retains its role.

member.summary: MS-TURN

member.summary: S_OK

member.summary: S_FALSE

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.NOT_INITIALIZED
member.summary: The audio stream has not been successfully initialized.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.ALREADY_INITIALIZED
member.summary: The IAudioClient object is already initialized.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.WRONG_ENDPOINT_TYPE
member.summary: The caller tried to access an IAudioCaptureClient interface on a rendering endpoint, or an IAudioRenderClient interface on a capture endpoint.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.DEVICE_INVALIDATED
member.summary: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.NOT_STOPPED
member.summary: The audio stream was not stopped at the time the call was made.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: The NumFramesRequested value exceeds the available buffer space (buffer size minus padding size).

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.OUT_OF_ORDER
member.summary: A previous IAudioRenderClient::GetBuffer call is still in effect.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT
member.summary: The audio engine (shared mode) or audio endpoint device (exclusive mode) does not support the specified format.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.DEVICE_IN_USE
member.summary: The endpoint device is already in use. Either the device is being used in exclusive mode, or the device is being used in shared mode and the caller asked to use the device in exclusive mode.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.BUFFER_OPERATION_PENDING
member.summary: Buffer cannot be accessed because a stream reset is in progress.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.EXCLUSIVE_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED
member.summary: The caller is requesting exclusive-mode use of the endpoint device, but the user has disabled exclusive-mode use of the device.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.ENDPOINT_CREATE_FAILED
member.summary: The method failed to create the audio endpoint for the render or the capture device. This can occur if the audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.SERVICE_NOT_RUNNING
member.summary: The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.EVENTHANDLE_NOT_EXPECTED
member.summary: The audio stream was not initialized for event-driven buffering.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.BUFDURATION_PERIOD_NOT_EQUAL
member.summary: The AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK flag is set but parameters hnsBufferDuration and hnsPeriodicity are not equal.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.EVENTHANDLE_NOT_SET
member.summary: The audio stream is configured to use event-driven buffering, but the caller has not called IAudioClient::SetEventHandle to set the event handle on the stream.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.BUFFER_SIZE_ERROR
member.summary: The stream is exclusive mode and uses event-driven buffering, but the client attempted to get a packet that was not the size of the buffer.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientReturnCodes.CPUUSAGE_EXCEEDED
member.summary: Indicates that the process-pass duration exceeded the maximum CPU usage. The audio engine keeps track of CPU usage by maintaining the number of times the process-pass duration exceeds the maximum CPU usage. The maximum CPU usage is calculated as a percent of the engine's periodicity. The percentage value is the system's CPU throttle value (within the range of 10% and 90%). If this value is not found, then the default value of 40% is used to calculate the maximum CPU usage.

member.summary: The data in the packet is not correlated with the previous packet's device position; this is possibly due to a stream state transition or timing glitch.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientSessionFlags.ExpireWhenUnowned
member.summary: The session expires when there are no associated streams and owning session control objects holding references.
member.remarks: AUDCLNT_SESSIONFLAGS_EXPIREWHENUNOWNED

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientSessionFlags.DisplayHide
member.summary: The volume control is hidden in the volume mixer user interface when the audio session is created. If the session associated with the stream already exists before IAudioClient::Initialize opens the stream, the volume control is displayed in the volume mixer.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientSessionFlags.DisplayHideWhenExpired
member.summary: The volume control is hidden in the volume mixer user interface after the session expires.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientShareMode.Shared
member.summary: The client can share the audio endpoint device with clients that run in other user-mode processes.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientShareMode.Exclusive
member.summary: The Windows audio service attempts to establish a connection in which the client has exclusive access to the audio endpoint device.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientStreamFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientStreamFlags.CrossProcess
member.summary: The audio session for the stream is a cross-process session. A cross-process session can accept streams from more than one process.
member.remarks: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_CROSSPROCESS

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientStreamFlags.Loopback
member.summary: Enables loopback recording. In loopback recording, the audio engine copies the audio stream that is being played by a rendering endpoint device into an audio endpoint buffer so that a WASAPI client can capture the stream.
member.remarks: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_LOOPBACK

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientStreamFlags.EventCallback
member.summary: Enables event-driven buffering.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientStreamFlags.NoPersist
member.summary: The volume and mute settings for an audio session will not persist across system restarts.

member.summary: This constant is new in Windows 7. The sample rate of the stream is adjusted to a rate specified by an application.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.AudioClientStreamOptions.Raw

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.DeviceState
member.summary: The DEVICE_STATE_XXX constants indicate the current state of an audio endpoint device.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.DeviceState.Active
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is active. That is, the audio adapter that connects to the endpoint device is present and enabled. In addition, if the endpoint device plugs into a jack on the adapter, then the endpoint device is plugged in.
member.remarks: DEVICE_STATE_ACTIVE

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.DeviceState.Disabled
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is disabled. The user has disabled the device in the Windows multimedia control panel.
member.remarks: DEVICE_STATE_DISABLED

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.DeviceState.NotPresent
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is not present because the audio adapter that connects to the endpoint device has been removed from the system, or the user has disabled the adapter device in Device Manager.
member.remarks: DEVICE_STATE_NOTPRESENT

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.DeviceState.Unplugged
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is unplugged. The audio adapter that contains the jack for the endpoint device is present and enabled, but the endpoint device is not plugged into the jack. Only a device with jack-presence detection can be in this state.
member.remarks: DEVICE_STATE_UNPLUGGED

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.DeviceState.All
member.summary: Includes audio endpoint devices in all states—active, disabled, not present, and unplugged.
member.remarks: DEVICE_STATEMASK_ALL

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.EDataFlow
member.summary: The EDataFlow enumeration defines constants that indicate the direction in which audio data flows between an audio endpoint device and an application.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.EDataFlow.Render
member.summary: Audio rendering stream. Audio data flows from the application to the audio endpoint device, which renders the stream.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.EDataFlow.Capture
member.summary: Audio capture stream. Audio data flows from the audio endpoint device that captures the stream, to the application.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.CoreAudio.EDataFlow.All
member.summary: Audio rendering or capture stream. Audio data can flow either from the application to the audio endpoint device, or from the audio endpoint device to the application.

member.summary: Resets the audio stream. Requires initialization. Reset is a control method that the client calls to reset a stopped audio stream. Resetting the stream flushes all pending data and resets the audio clock stream position to 0. This method fails if it is called on a stream that is not stopped

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Dmo.OutputStreamInfoFlags
member.summary: This enumerated type defines flags that describe an output stream.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Dmo.OutputStreamInfoFlags.WHOLE_SAMPLES
member.summary: The stream contains whole samples. Samples do not span multiple buffers, and buffers do not contain partial samples.
member.remarks: DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_WHOLE_SAMPLES

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Dmo.OutputStreamInfoFlags.SINGLE_SAMPLE_PER_BUFFER
member.summary: Each buffer contains exactly one sample.
member.remarks: DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_SINGLE_SAMPLE_PER_BUFFER

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Dmo.OutputStreamInfoFlags.FIXED_SAMPLE_SIZE
member.summary: All the samples in this stream are the same size.
member.remarks: DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_FIXED_SAMPLE_SIZE

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Dmo.OutputStreamInfoFlags.DISCARDABLE
member.summary: The stream is discardable. Within calls to IMediaObject::ProcessOutput, the DMO can discard data for this stream without copying it to an output buffer.
member.remarks: DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_DISCARDABLE

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Dmo.OutputStreamInfoFlags.OPTIONAL
member.summary: The stream is optional. An optional stream is discardable. The application can also ignore this stream entirely; it does not have to set the media type for the stream. Optional streams generally contain additional information or data not needed by all applications.
member.remarks: DMO_OUTPUT_STREAMF_OPTIONAL

member.summary: Closes the current stream and releases any resources (such as sockets and file handles) associated with the current stream.

member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Streams.WaveFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
he zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Streams.WaveFileStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
The reference point used to obtain the new position.

member.name: M:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Streams.WaveFileStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Streams.WaveFileStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.summary: Occurs when the conversion finished.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.ConvertFlags.BlockAlign
member.summary: Only integral numbers of blocks will be converted. Converted data will end on block-aligned boundaries. An application should use this flag for all conversions on a stream until there is not enough source data to convert to a block-aligned destination. In this case, the last conversion should be specified without this flag.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.ConvertFlags.Start
member.summary: ACM conversion stream should begin returning pending instance data. For example, if a conversion stream holds instance data, such as the end of an echo filter operation, this flag will cause the stream to start returning this remaining data with optional source data. This flag can be specified with the ACM_STREAMCONVERTF_START flag.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.ConvertFlags.End
member.summary: ACM conversion stream should reinitialize its instance data. For example, if a conversion stream holds instance data, such as delta or predictor information, this flag will restore the stream to starting defaults. This flag can be specified with the ACM_STREAMCONVERTF_END flag.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails
member.summary: Interop structure for ACM driver details (ACMDRIVERDETAILS) http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd742889(v=VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.cbSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the valid information contained in the ACMDRIVERDETAILS structure. An application should initialize this member to the size, in bytes, of the desired information. The size specified in this member must be large enough to contain the cbStruct member of the ACMDRIVERDETAILS structure. When the acmDriverDetails function returns, this member contains the actual size of the information returned. The returned information will never exceed the requested size.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.fccType
member.summary: Type of the driver. For ACM drivers, set this member to ACMDRIVERDETAILS_FCCTYPE_AUDIOCODEC.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.fccComp
member.summary: Subtype of the driver. This member is currently set to ACMDRIVERDETAILS_FCCCOMP_UNDEFINED (zero).

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.manufacturerId
member.summary: Manufacturer identifier. Manufacturer identifiers are defined in Manufacturer and Product Identifiers. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd757146(v=VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.productId
member.summary: Product identifier. Product identifiers are defined in Manufacturer and Product Identifiers.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.ACMVersion
member.summary: Version of the ACM for which this driver was compiled. The version number is a hexadecimal number in the format 0xAABBCCCC, where AA is the major version number, BB is the minor version number, and CCCC is the build number. The version parts (major, minor, and build) should be displayed as decimal numbers.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.driverVersion
member.summary: Version of the driver. The version number is a hexadecimal number in the format 0xAABBCCCC, where AA is the major version number, BB is the minor version number, and CCCC is the build number. The version parts (major, minor, and build) should be displayed as decimal numbers

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.supportFlags
member.summary: Support flags for the driver. The following values are defined:

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.formatTagsCount
member.summary: Number of unique format tags supported by this driver.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.filterTagsCount
member.summary: Number of unique filter tags supported by this driver.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.hicon
member.summary: Handle to a custom icon for this driver. An application can use this icon for referencing the driver visually. This member can be NULL.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.shortName
member.summary: Null-terminated string that describes the name of the driver. This string is intended to be displayed in small spaces.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.longName
member.summary: Null-terminated string that describes the full name of the driver. This string is intended to be displayed in large (descriptive) spaces.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.copyright
member.summary: Null-terminated string that provides copyright information for the driver.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.licensing
member.summary: Null-terminated string that provides special licensing information for the driver

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverDetails.features
member.summary: Null-terminated string that provides special feature information for the driver.

member.summary: Driver-support flags specific to the driver specified by hadid. These flags are identical to the fdwSupport flags of the ACMDRIVERDETAILS structure. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.

member.summary: ACMDRIVERDETAILS_SUPPORTF_CODEC - Codec

member.summary: ACMDRIVERDETAILS_SUPPORTF_ASYNC - Async

member.summary: ACMDRIVERDETAILS_SUPPORTF_LOCAL - Local

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.ACMDriverEnumCallback
member.summary: The acmDriverEnumCallback function specifies a callback function used with the acmDriverEnum function. The acmDriverEnumCallback name is a placeholder for an application-defined function name. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd742891(VS.85).aspx
member.param: Handle to an ACM driver identifier.

Driver-support flags specific to the driver specified by hadid. These flags are identical to the fdwSupport flags of the ACMDRIVERDETAILS structure. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.
member.returns: The callback function must return TRUE to continue enumeration or FALSE to stop enumeration.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverEnumFlags
member.summary: Flags for enumerating ACM drivers. The following values are defined.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverEnumFlags.NoLocal
member.summary: Disabled ACM drivers should be included in the enumeration. Drivers can be disabled by the user through the Control Panel or by an application using the acmDriverPriority function. If a driver is disabled, the fdwSupport parameter to the callback function will have the ACMDRIVERDETAILS_SUPPORTF_DISABLED flag set.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.DriverEnumFlags.Disabled
member.summary: Only global drivers should be included in the enumeration.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails
member.summary: The ACMFORMATDETAILS structure details a waveform-audio format for a specific format tag for an ACM driver. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd742913(v=VS.85).aspx

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.structSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure. This member must be initialized before an application calls the acmFormatDetails or acmFormatEnum function. The size specified by this member must be large enough to contain the base ACMFORMATDETAILS structure. When the acmFormatDetails function returns, this member contains the actual size of the information returned. The returned information will never exceed the requested size.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.formatIndex
member.summary: Index of the format to retrieve details for. The index ranges from zero to one less than the number of standard formats supported by an ACM driver for a format tag. The number of standard formats supported by a driver for a format tag is contained in the cStandardFormats member of the ACMFORMATTAGDETAILS structure. The dwFormatIndex member is used only when an application queries standard format details about a driver by index; otherwise, this member should be zero. Also, this member will be set to zero by the ACM when an application queries for details on a format; in other words, this member is used only for input and is never returned by the ACM or an ACM driver.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.formatTag
member.summary: Waveform-audio format tag that the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure describes. This member is used for input for the ACM_FORMATDETAILSF_INDEX query flag. For the ACM_FORMATDETAILSF_FORMAT query flag, this member must be initialized to the same format tag as the pwfx member specifies. If a call to the acmFormatDetails function is successful, this member is always returned. This member should be set to WAVE_FORMAT_UNKNOWN for all other query flags.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.supportFlags
member.summary: Driver-support flags specific to the specified format. These flags are identical to the fdwSupport flags of the ACMDRIVERDETAILS structure. This member can be a combination of the following values and indicates which operations the driver supports for the format tag:

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.waveFormatPointer
member.summary: Pointer to a WAVEFORMATEX structure that will receive the format details. This structure requires no initialization by the application unless the ACM_FORMATDETAILSF_FORMAT flag is specified in the acmFormatDetails function. In this case, the wFormatTag member of the WAVEFORMATEX structure must be equal to the dwFormatTag of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.waveFormatByteSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, available for pwfx to receive the format details. The acmMetrics and acmFormatTagDetails functions can be used to determine the maximum size required for any format available for the specified driver (or for all installed ACM drivers).

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatDetails.formatDescription
member.summary: String that describes the format for the dwFormatTag type. If the acmFormatDetails function is successful, this string is always returned.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags
member.summary: Format Enumeration Flags

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.Convert
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_CONVERT The WAVEFORMATEX structure pointed to by the pwfx member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure is valid. The enumerator will only enumerate destination formats that can be converted from the given pwfx format.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.Hardware
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_HARDWARE The enumerator should only enumerate formats that are supported as native input or output formats on one or more of the installed waveform-audio devices. This flag provides a way for an application to choose only formats native to an installed waveform-audio device. This flag must be used with one or both of the ACM_FORMATENUMF_INPUT and ACM_FORMATENUMF_OUTPUT flags. Specifying both ACM_FORMATENUMF_INPUT and ACM_FORMATENUMF_OUTPUT will enumerate only formats that can be opened for input or output. This is true regardless of whether this flag is specified.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.Input
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_INPUT Enumerator should enumerate only formats that are supported for input (recording).

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.Channels
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_NCHANNELS The nChannels member of the WAVEFORMATEX structure pointed to by the pwfx member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure is valid. The enumerator will enumerate only a format that conforms to this attribute.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.SamplesPerSecond
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_NSAMPLESPERSEC The nSamplesPerSec member of the WAVEFORMATEX structure pointed to by the pwfx member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure is valid. The enumerator will enumerate only a format that conforms to this attribute.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.Output
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_OUTPUT Enumerator should enumerate only formats that are supported for output (playback).

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.Suggest
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_SUGGEST The WAVEFORMATEX structure pointed to by the pwfx member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure is valid. The enumerator will enumerate all suggested destination formats for the given pwfx format. This mechanism can be used instead of the ACMFormatSuggest function to allow an application to choose the best suggested format for conversion. The dwFormatIndex member will always be set to zero on return.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.BitsPerSample
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_WBITSPERSAMPLE The wBitsPerSample member of the WAVEFORMATEX structure pointed to by the pwfx member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure is valid. The enumerator will enumerate only a format that conforms to this attribute.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatEnumFlags.FormatTag
member.summary: ACM_FORMATENUMF_WFORMATTAG The wFormatTag member of the WAVEFORMATEX structure pointed to by the pwfx member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure is valid. The enumerator will enumerate only a format that conforms to this attribute. The dwFormatTag member of the ACMFORMATDETAILS structure must be equal to the wFormatTag member.

member.name: T:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatSuggestFlags
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd742916%28VS.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatSuggestFlags.FormatTag
member.summary: ACM_FORMATSUGGESTF_WFORMATTAG The wFormatTag member of the structure pointed to by pwfxDst is valid. The ACM will query acceptable installed drivers that can suggest a destination format matching wFormatTag or fail.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatSuggestFlags.Channels
member.summary: ACM_FORMATSUGGESTF_NCHANNELS The nChannels member of the structure pointed to by pwfxDst is valid. The ACM will query acceptable installed drivers that can suggest a destination format matching nChannels or fail.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatSuggestFlags.SamplesPerSecond
member.summary: ACM_FORMATSUGGESTF_NSAMPLESPERSEC The wBitsPerSample member of the structure pointed to by pwfxDst is valid. The ACM will query acceptable installed drivers that can suggest a destination format matching wBitsPerSample or fail.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatSuggestFlags.BitsPerSample
member.summary: ACM_FORMATSUGGESTF_WBITSPERSAMPLE The wBitsPerSample member of the structure pointed to by pwfxDst is valid. The ACM will query acceptable installed drivers that can suggest a destination format matching wBitsPerSample or fail.

member.name: F:Ozeki.Media.Audio.Core.ACM.FormatSuggestFlags.TypeMask
member.summary: ACM_FORMATSUGGESTF_TYPEMASK
